intro: Stigmaphyllon littorale var. trilobum, commonly known as the coastal stigmaphyllon, is a species native to coastal regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are usually white or pink, clustered in small inflorescences. It is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate periodic flooding, making it a hardy species in coastal environments. The plant plays a role in stabilizing dune systems and providing habitat for coastal wildlife.
